====Europe====
====Europe====
In the UK, the Galaxy Nexus was made available on [[Vodafone (UK)|Vodafone]], [[O2 (UK)|O2]], and [[Hutchison 3G|Three]] on November 17, 2011 at a price of Â£549.99. The version sold is the [[Evolved HSPA|HSPA+]] version.<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/27/amazon-outs-galaxy-nexus-release-date-available-in-the-uk-on-no/ Samsung makes Galaxy Nexus release date official, available in the UK on November 17th]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref>
In the UK, the Galaxy Nexus was made available on [[Vodafone (UK)|Vodafone]], [[O2 (UK)|O2]], and [[Hutchison 3G|Three]] on November 17, 2011 at a price of Â£549.99. The version sold is the [[Evolved HSPA|HSPA+]] version.<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/27/amazon-outs-galaxy-nexus-release-date-available-in-the-uk-on-no/ Samsung makes Galaxy Nexus release date official, available in the UK on November 17th]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref>
â

====North America====
====North America====
Line 113: Line 113:
==Volume bug==
==Volume bug==
â
A few days after the UK release, some users started noticing a glitch with the volume rocker, where the phone would lower the volume seemingly at random.<ref>http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=22021</ref><ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/21/european-galaxy-nexus-owners-complain-of-erratic-volume-issue-v/</ref>
+
A few days after the UK release, some users started noticing a glitch with the volume rocker, where the phone would lower the volume seemingly at random.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=22021 |title=Issue 22021 - android - Volume down/mute on Galaxy Nexus running 4.0 - Android - An Open Handset Alliance Project - Google Project Hosting |publisher=Code.google.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/21/european-galaxy-nexus-owners-complain-of-erratic-volume-issue-v/ |title=European Galaxy Nexus owners complain of erratic volume issue (video) |publisher=Engadget |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref>
â
On the 22 November 2011, the UK retailer [[Handtec]] temporarily stopped Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming that there was a problem with its stock of devices.<ref>http://www.handtec.co.uk/blog/2011/11/samsung-galaxy-nexus-shipping-update/</ref><ref name=Vergebug>{{cite web|last=Ziegler|first=Chris|title=Retailer Handtec stops Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming volume bug|url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/22/2580432/retailer-handtec-stops-galaxy-nexus-shipments-after-confirming-volume|work=11-22-2011|publisher=The Verge|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>
+
On the 22 November 2011, the UK retailer [[Handtec]] temporarily stopped Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming that there was a problem with its stock of devices.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.handtec.co.uk/blog/2011/11/samsung-galaxy-nexus-shipping-update/ |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus â Shipping update | Handtec Blog |publisher=Handtec.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref><ref name=Vergebug>{{cite web|last=Ziegler|first=Chris|title=Retailer Handtec stops Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming volume bug|url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/22/2580432/retailer-handtec-stops-galaxy-nexus-shipments-after-confirming-volume|work=11-22-2011|publisher=The Verge|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>
â
Soon after, both Google and Samsung confirmed the issue, saying they already had a fix and phones would be updated "as soon as possible"<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/23/google-responds-to-galaxy-nexus-volume-complaints-says-fix-is-i/</ref><ref>http://www.androidpolice.com/2011/11/23/google-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-is-not-hardware-related-software-fix-already-on-the-way/</ref><ref>http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9222128/Samsung_to_issue_fix_for_Galaxy_Nexus_volume_issue</ref><ref>http://news.cnet.com/8301-1035_3-57330247-94/google-acknowledges-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-in-u.k/</ref><ref>http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/google-speaks-up-over-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-10024859/</ref><ref>http://www.pcworld.com/article/244695/samsung_has_developed_a_fix_for_galaxy_nexus_sound_volume_issue.html</ref><ref>http://www.slashgear.com/samsung-confirms-nexus-volume-fix-but-freezes-shipments-23197598/</ref><ref>https://twitter.com/#!/samsunguk/status/139355492504973312</ref>
+
Soon after, both Google and Samsung confirmed the issue, saying they already had a fix and phones would be updated "as soon as possible"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/23/google-responds-to-galaxy-nexus-volume-complaints-says-fix-is-i/ |title=Galaxy Nexus volume fix in the works, Google confirms |publisher=Engadget |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.androidpolice.com/2011/11/23/google-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-is-not-hardware-related-software-fix-already-on-the-way/ |title=Google: Galaxy Nexus Volume Bug Is Fixable In Software - Fix Already On The Way |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Mikael Ricknäs |url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9222128/Samsung_to_issue_fix_for_Galaxy_Nexus_volume_issue |title=Samsung to issue fix for Galaxy Nexus volume issue |publisher=Computerworld |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Westaway |first=Luke |url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-1035_3-57330247-94/google-acknowledges-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-in-u.k/ |title=Google acknowledges Galaxy Nexus volume bug in U.K. | Mobile - CNET News |publisher=News.cnet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Woods |first=Ben |url=http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/google-speaks-up-over-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-10024859/ |title=Google speaks up over Galaxy Nexus volume bug | ZDNet UK |publisher=Zdnet.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/244695/samsung_has_developed_a_fix_for_galaxy_nexus_sound_volume_issue.html |title=Samsung Has Developed a Fix for Galaxy Nexus Sound Volume Issue |publisher=PCWorld |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/samsung-confirms-nexus-volume-fix-but-freezes-shipments-23197598/ |title=Samsung confirms Nexus volume fix but freezes shipments |publisher=SlashGear |date=2006-10-27 |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref><ref>https://twitter.com/#!/samsunguk/status/139355492504973312</ref>

â
According to [[Engadget]] editor Darren Murph, the Galaxy Nexus was "smooth as ever. Without question, this is easily the slickest, most polished version of Android yet"<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-ice-cream-sandwich-android-4-0-a-hands-on-screenshot-g/ Google Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0): a hands-on screenshot gallery]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref> and that "The entire experience just felt polished. In a way, it's as if Android's growing a bit and maturing before our eyes", concluding with "Overall, we're thrilled with how the first [[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|ICS]] handset has turned out. It's understated, sleek, beautiful and packs a display that's destined to drop jaws."<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on (video)]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref>
+
According to [[Engadget]] editor Darren Murph, the Galaxy Nexus was "smooth as ever. Without question, this is easily the slickest, most polished version of Android yet"<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-ice-cream-sandwich-android-4-0-a-hands-on-screenshot-g/ Google Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0): a hands-on screenshot gallery]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref> and that "The entire experience just felt polished. In a way, it's as if Android's growing a bit and maturing before our eyes", concluding with "Overall, we're thrilled with how the first [[Ice Cream Sandwich (operating system)|ICS]] handset has turned out. It's understated, sleek, beautiful and packs a display that's destined to drop jaws."<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on (video)]. Engadget. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref>
In a [[T3 (magazine)|T3]] review Thomas Tamblyn noted the camera was "quicker than many digital cameras" and concluded saying "the whole experience is very fluid. Even in its current form [a pre-release version] It feels like a version of Android that is already very polished."<ref>{{cite web|author=Updated 18:31 26 Oct 2011 by Thomas Tamblyn |url=http://www.t3.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus review: Hands on |publisher=T3 |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref>
In a [[T3 (magazine)|T3]] review Thomas Tamblyn noted the camera was "quicker than many digital cameras" and concluded saying "the whole experience is very fluid. Even in its current form [a pre-release version] It feels like a version of Android that is already very polished."<ref>{{cite web|author=Updated 18:31 26 Oct 2011 by Thomas Tamblyn |url=http://www.t3.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus review: Hands on |publisher=T3 |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref>
